node.title: From Bond’s sultry lover to a Wes Anderson muse: Léa Seydoux on being typecast
node.alt: A blonde woman in her 30s turns her head to the side to look straight into the camera. She is leaning against a sandstone wall.
node.description: The French actor steals the show in The French Dispatch, mixing vulnerability with humour as a prison guard-turned-artist's model; it's just the latest in a long line of sultry, enigmatic heartbreakers she has played.
node.content:
["In Wes Anderson's new star-studded film The French Dispatch, L\u00e9a Seydoux (No Time to Die) plays a prison guard who becomes a muse for an inmate.", "It's the latest in a long line of sultry, enigmatic heartbreakers the in-demand actor has embodied since her breakthrough role in 2008 French arthouse film La Belle Personne, and honed in subsequent films as varied as Woody Allen's Midnight in Paris, Cannes-acclaimed lesbian romance Blue Is the Warmest Colour, and Mission: Impossible \u2014 Ghost Protocol.", "", "
In 2013, Seydoux won the Palme d'Or at Cannes with co-star Ad\u00e8le Exarchopoulos and director Abdellatif Kechiche for Blue Is the Warmest Colour.(Supplied: Transmission)
", "Her recent turn as Daniel Craig's secretive lover Madeleine Swann \u2013 whom critics have dubbed \"the antithesis of the Bond girl\" \u2013 is perhaps the epitome of her mercurial on-screen persona.", "\"For some reason people think that I am mysterious. Which I am not, at all!\" the actor laughs, speaking from Paris via Zoom.", "\"I don't know\u2026 I think it's because I am melancholic,\" she says, quietening.", "In The French Dispatch, Simone is a mixture of fire and ice. A guard at the Ennui prison, she poses nude for Moses Rosenthaler (Benicio Del Toro), an artist serving a life sentence for murder, providing the inspiration for the radically abstract paintings that bring him world renown.", "\"Simone is Benicio's inspiration; she is the object of creation,\" Seydoux explains.", "", "
Seydoux and Anderson share an interest in French cinema, particularly the French New Wave, including the films of Godard and Fran\u00e7ois Truffaut.(Supplied: Disney)
", "Back in uniform, she snaps her fingers and sharply orders him about.", "Anderson wrote the part for Seydoux, who is now a regular amongst his ensemble, having most recently voiced the glamorous poodle-King Charles cross Nutmeg in the French version of Isle of Dogs.", "For their latest collaboration, Seydoux says the few lines that Anderson sent her initially were \"rather abstract\" \u2013 but he goes above and beyond in bringing them to life for his actors.", "", "
\u201cThe movie is sort of a collection of short stories. So I will send you just the parts that you need to read,\u201d Anderson texted Seydoux when he offered her the part.(Supplied: Disney)
", "\"He's funny, Wes \u2013 not many people know, but he makes a little animated film of the script. When you arrive on set, it's on an iPad, so you can watch the film before it's even [made]. It's like a beautiful piece of art,\" she explains.", "\"He does all the voices, he plays all the characters. So he already played Simone.\"", "Seydoux describes Anderson's new film as \"like a comic book\", and its vision of her home country as \"idealised\".", "\"But I think that works\u2026 I mean, it's part of Wes,\" she says.", "In this cinematic wunderkammer, even the smallest detail is crafted with care, from the dandy-fine stitching of Simone's fitted uniform, to the artful poses she strikes (composed with veteran choreographer Philippe Decouffl\u00e9) in a series of tableaux: hanging from the ceiling like an acrobat; perched on one leg on a stool; or bending, in profile, arched like a cat.", "Seydoux appears in the first of the film's three extended chapters and has only a handful of lines. But amongst the Hollywood-heavy ensemble, her presence is arguably the most memorable; her glacial stares and borderline mechanical movements are infused with unexpected humour and pathos.", "\"It's funny, and at the same time it's deep, it's moving; there are many contrasts. It was great fun to do.\"", "
The paradox
", "When I ask Seydoux if she recognises herself in Simone, she answers in a jokey tough-guy voice: \"Oh, I'm as tough as Simone, yes, I'm really like that,\" and then bursts out laughing, flashing a radiant gap-toothed smile.", "", "
\u201cL\u00e9a Seydoux has an impossible-to-replicate charm on-screen,\u201d No Time to Die director Cary Joji Fukunaga told the New York Times.(Supplied: Universal/Nicola Dove)
", "\"No, no, not really\u2026\" she says, suddenly turning shy.", "This switch in temperament recalls the way many of her performances spin on a dime from gutsy determination to intense vulnerability.", "\"When you act in a film you always have your subjectivity,\" the actor says.", "\"What I liked about this character is that she's very tough and dry \u2013 or she's totally in it, and suddenly she opens up. Like the scene with Benicio [Del Toro], when we lay down and he says, 'I love you', and I say, 'I don't love you' \u2013 at the same time I have tears in my eyes.", "\"It's always a balance between this distance and very close, like 'first degree'. I like this paradox,\" Seydoux explains.", "
Playing the muse
", "Alongside The French Dispatch, Seydoux starred in three other titles this year at the Cannes Film Festival (though she was unable to attend after testing positive for COVID).", "", "
Ildik\u00f3 Enyedi\u2019s The Story of My Wife, starring Seydoux and Gijs Naber, also premiered at Cannes, and was part of the Official Competition of Sydney Film Festival in November.(Supplied: Films Boutique)
", "She received particular praise for her performance as a celebrity news anchor in Bruno Dumont's satire France \u2013 a piece of casting that perhaps tilts at the Seydoux family's links to major French film studios Path\u00e9 and Gaumont.", "And she appeared as a muse \u2013 again \u2013 in Arnaud Desplechin's Philip Roth adaptation Deception, playing an adulterous English lover to a writer named (ahem) Philip.", "Both films are due to reach Australian screens in 2022. (The busy actor also graces upcoming movies from auteurs David Cronenberg and Mia Hansen-L\u00f8ve.)", "Directors and casting agents might associate Seydoux with a certain inscrutable, femme fatale-like figure \u2013 but she seems amused by the image that is being built around her.", "\"In France, you have many actors who have a strong nature. It's not like the American cinema [whose actors] tend to perform. It's the opposite in France; they don't really perform, they play with their own nature.", "", "
Cannes Film Festival director Thierry Fr\u00e9maux has described Seydoux as \u201cBardot, plus Binoche, plus Kate Moss, and sometimes all three at once\u201d.(Supplied: Getty Images/Jason Mendez)
", "\"I think that I'm a mix; I am a nature but also I like to transform. So maybe it's hard for people to put me in a box. I think that's why they fantasise about me a little bit, like I'm a blank page.", "In the past, she's suggested that this ability to transform on-screen allows her to slip naturally into a filmmaker's universe, which is where she says she feels most at home.", "Critics, struggling to articulate her allure, have likened her to iconic French screen sirens such as Brigitte Bardot, Juliette Binoche and Catherine Deneuve.", "Flattering as the intent may be, she says of these comparisons, \"I can't recognise myself\".", "\"Perhaps it's pretentious to say, but I think that maybe I've invented my own way of acting,\" Seydoux reflects, before collapsing into fits of laughter at herself once again.", "The French Dispatch is in cinemas now.", "No Time to Die is in cinemas now.\u00a0"]
